page.title: 18 Otley past and present
page.content: The Post Office had a small telephone kiosk inside which was a glass booth with a stool. To contact the exchange it was necessary to crank a handle on the side of the phone. Across the road there was firstly a wheelwrights and then a carpenters. Most of the timber came from locally cut trees. At the correct time a mobile steam engine would come and saw the timber into planks. Quite clearly the demise of these businesses began with the changes in farming and the increase in mechanisation . As more and more businesses closed then the whole character and pattern of the village changed. Nowadays there are few service industries left. Most people will travel to Ipswich or Woodbridge for their weekly needs.
